IRE244H1-F-20175.orgName: Industrial Relations and Human Resources, Centre for (IRE)
IRE244H1-F-20175.courseDescription: Introduction to the institutions, issues and legislation affecting the employment relationship in the public and private sectors in Canada, with emphasis on collective bargaining. The economic and political environment, history of the labour movement, union organization, certification, contract negotiation, strikes, dispute resolution, contract administration and grievances.
IRE244H1-F-20175.prerequisite: Enrolment in the Employment Relations program (ASSPE1535/ASMAJ1535) or 4.0 or more FCEs and a minimum cgpa of 2.3.
IRE244H1-F-20175.webTimetableInstructions: ACORN does not check for prerequisites/exclusions in real time. These will be checked by the Program Office staff throughout the summer session. Students enrolled in courses for which they do not have the published requirements may have their registration in those courses cancelled at any time. For course details click on the course code in the timetable below and review the course description, prerequisites etc. before enrolling in a IRE course. Contact the Program office if you have any questions about IRE courses. WW CHRM Certificate of Human Resource Management students are also eligible to enroll when course enrolment begins on April 6th, 2017.

IRE260H1-F-20175.orgName: Industrial Relations and Human Resources, Centre for (IRE)
IRE260H1-F-20175.courseDescription: Introduction to the nature of organizations and the behaviour of individuals and groups within organizations, including topics such as culture and diversity, reward systems, motivation, leadership, politics, communication, decision-making, conflict and group processes. Not recommended for students in Commerce programs.
IRE260H1-F-20175.prerequisite: Enrolment in the Employment Relations program (ASSPE1535/ASMAJ1535) or 4.0 or more FCEs and a minimum cgpa of 2.3

IRE430H1-F-20175.orgName: Industrial Relations and Human Resources, Centre for (IRE)
IRE430H1-F-20175.courseTitle: Canadian Employment Law & the Non-Union Workplace
IRE430H1-F-20175.courseDescription: The course will focus on the law governing employment in a non-unionized workplace. Specifically, it will cover every phase of the employment relationship from hiring to termination and beyond and the rights and obligations of employers and employees as developed by the Courts and under employment-related statutes (namely the Employment Standards Act, 2000 and the Human Rights Code.) The course will also cover provisions from the Occupational Health and Safety Act.
